name: Al-Arqam Islamic School
mission: TO MEET THE EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF THE MUSLIM CHILDREN LIVING WITHIN THE GREATER SACRAMENTO AREA.
theoryOfChange: Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory has published "Schoolwide Learning Outcomes (SLOs)" or "Student Learning Goals (SLGs)" that serve as a strategic framework. These goals are focused on establishing strong, cohesive, and engaging school programs designed to impact students academically, spiritually, socially, and physically. The school's updated SLOs are conveyed through the acrostic TORCH. The Student Learning Goals include five key areas: to live Islam, become lifelong learners, be effective communicators, be citizens of the world, and honor themselves physically and spiritually.
zakatClaimEvidence: The donation page for Al-Arqam Islamic School (Sacramento, CA, USA) provides options for checks, PayPal, and Zelle donations but does not explicitly mention 'zakat' or dedicated zakat funds.

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 24/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Al-Arqam Islamic School shows strong impact and moderate alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The donation page for Al-Arqam Islamic School (Sacramento, CA, USA) provides options for checks, PayPal, and Zelle donations but does not explicitly mention 'zakat' or dedicated zakat funds.

all_citations.claim: The organization reports a program expense ratio of 98.1% and 9.1 months of working capital.
Total revenue for the period was $4,155,519 with a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.
The school provides college preparatory academics and an International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program.
The organization operates as Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory.
The school maintains a student honor code and parent policy handbook to guide its educational environment.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 60/100 reflecting high internal financial efficiency and program dedication, though the overall score is tempered by low data confidence and limited external transparency.
areas_for_improvement: Low data confidence due to limited third-party impact verification
Limited information regarding specific long-term student outcomes and alumni success

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 24/50, the school shows a moderate fit for donors interested in global education and Islamic schooling [3]. The low donor fit rating suggests that while the mission is clear, there is limited evidence of broader community-wide engagement or specialized donor pathways beyond the local student body [5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The school demonstrates high capacity-building impact through its 98.1% program expense ratio and specialized IB Diploma Program [1][2]. While the organization maintains a healthy 9.1 months of working capital, the impact score of 37/50 reflects a lack of publicly available cost-per-beneficiary data and low data confidence [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Al-Arqam Islamic School provides a rigorous college preparatory and International Baccalaureate education to Muslim students in the Greater Sacramento area.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 98.1%, ensuring nearly all funds directly support educational services
Offers the prestigious International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program
Strong financial stability with 9.1 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: Al-Arqam Islamic School is a dedicated educational institution focused on meeting the academic and spiritual needs of Muslim children through a comprehensive college preparatory curriculum [1][3]. The school is distinguished by its International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program and a commitment to high academic standards guided by an Islamic honor code [4][5].
